CatDescriptText: Mr. Richard Vann, bar and hotel owner, Third Ward and Mr. Lamar Cato, substitute teacher, Penn Hills, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 10, 1962, pg. 7  with question: "Who had the more dangerous assignment--Lindbergh or Glenn?" Mr. Richard Vann's answer reads: "Glenn did because if he had come down, nobody would have found him; whereas this could not have been the case in regards to Lindberg."  Mr. Lamar Cato's answer reads: "I think Glenn, because Lindberg only sailed across the Atlantic, whereas Glenn was in orbit around the earth three times."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Richard Vann wearing plaid jacket and hat, standing on sidewalk in front of buildings; Portrait of Lamar Cato wearing trench coat, hat, and eyeglasses, standing on sidewalk in front of buildings and truck marked "Motor Freight Express"
